title: Improving Logical Flow
learning_objectives: Choose transitions that fit logic, not just sound smooth
Identify sentence/paragraph roles in the overall flow
Strengthen organization by placing sentences where they fit best
Avoid traps that 'sound right' but misrepresent logic

content.title: Organization & Transitions
content.subtitle: Logical flow and connections
points: Logical flow must match meaning, not just sound

content.title: Common Pitfalls
content.explanation: Transitions like 'however' or 'therefore' sound smooth but may misrepresent logic.
content.example: 'The park was popular. However, it had many visitors.' ‚Üí Trap: 'However' suggests contrast, but logic = continuation.

content.title: 3-Step Process
steps: Step 2: Predict connector before looking at choices.
Step 3: Eliminate smooth but illogical transitions.

content.title: Apply the Strategy
content.question: Which transition best fits? 'The project was completed ahead of schedule. ________, the team celebrated their success.'
content.explanation: Logic = cause-effect (completed ‚Üí celebrated). Correct = 'Therefore'. Others distort logic.

content.title: Flow Mastery
content.summary: Organization tests logic, not just style.
key_points: Sentence placement = must fit logical order.
